intro: Cissampelos pareira var. hirta, commonly known as the hairy cissampelos, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, winged fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
